The movie is have good idea , but...anything else is just garbage , the storytelling and storyline is just so boring !
The movie is just a big screen for a lot of ads not thing else .

Do I need to explain this?! The Emoji Movie is hands down the cringiest kids' film I have ever seen in my entire life!! This movie is a complete disaster. From start to finish, it's an embarrassing attempt at creating a story around something as hollow as emojis. The plot is weak, the characters are obnoxious, and the humor falls completely flat. Emoji movie? No thanks! This movie is so cringe! The animation looks cheap, the voice acting is forced, and the entire concept feels like a cash grab.The so-called "adventure" is just a bunch of random, disconnected scenes that do nothing to engage the audience. The message it tries to convey about being yourself and embracing individuality feels like a lazy afterthought, tacked on just to make the film feel like it has some depth. There's no real heart or substance here, just flashing colors and tired jokes that will make you cringe at every turn.Watching this felt like an hour and a half of my life I'll never get back. The movie's pandering to children is painfully obvious, but honestly, it fails at that too. It's so forced and irritating that even kids would get bored. Avoid this at all costs unless you're looking for a full-on cringe fest. The Emoji Movie is a sad excuse for a film and deserves to be forgotten.

Snubbed from the oscars. Brilliant storytelling, excellent characters, prestigious acting. Was disappointed. Didn't have enough poop jokes. The poop jokes were always funny and never out of place. Personally believe this deserved a trilogy.

This movie is possibly one of the worst animated movies I have ever watched. Whenever they cracked a joke it literally made me so uncomfortable that I was squirming in my seat with an upset stomach. Nothing about this movie was original and the depictions of kids nowadays is entirely inaccurate. It's almost as if the producers did no research whatsoever during production. Warning: if you watch this your mental health is at stake.

This movie was an emojinal rollercoaster. The pathos derived from its intense moments was indescribibile. What were these moments, exactly? Well, while watching the movie I noticed my retractable dildo had fallen off the shelf and knocked a lamp off, starting a fire in the house. I began getting hot in my seat, thinking this was some emotional work from the movie. Alas, I reluctantly unglued my eyes from the screen, and looked behind me, and everything was fine. Apparently my doctor told me later I was off my medications, as well as abusing an unprescribed dose of LSD. Now that I'm better and on my medications, I can wholeheartedly say that this movie was a masterpiece.

This move is the best move I've ever seen and the only move I've ever given a perfect 501988147 out of 10 and for good reason the characters were very developed and were not rushed at all the romantic was overs and the characters had good chemistry over all this move did hreat and all the bad reviews were just being paid

The Animation 10/10 - Brilliant
Really colorful and vibrant world, the art style is very cute and warming to watch. They did a fantastic job bringing the emojis to life, and it was really nice to see the visual experience the emojis had through various well known applications.The Story 9/10 - Great
The story definitely gave me subtle reminders of Wreck it Ralph. In the end it's a story about a defective emoji who really wants to fit in and be like the rest of his peers and family. It's heartwarming that he learns that being different is not bad; very similar concept to Wreck it Ralph. The journeys through the apps are exciting and really capture the essence of the apps, bringing a sense of liveliness to applications that we only get to see through a flat screen. During the entire film you get to experience various emotions and two major climactic scenes which revolved around deleting of apps and data. There were few parts of the movie where you lose interest or aren't really sure what is going on but it was overall really a fun experience. Conclusion 
The collaboration of animation, technology and new social norms have evolved to create an opportunity for this movie to exist. It was overall a great fun movie to watch for adults and kids.

I always thought this movie would be stupid but I put it on for my daughter and we're both big fans. I have it on at least once a day, she really seems to love it. If you like puns and don't have a stick up  this is the movie for you.

This is the greatest film to ever be created. It's full of wit, charm, and Family Guy funny moments. My favorite part was when the hand ate his own puke, classic humor that never gets old. The plot is fairly simple, our main character, Gene, is a meh emoji. Gene struggles to fit in because he has dynamic emotions. Gene then goes on a quest to become static, and that concludes my review

If the makers of Tuscan Milk and the creators of the Three Wolf Moon shirt decided to make a film. Emoji Movie would be the result. Bright, crisp fluid animation meets the modern-day version of Shakespeare (though nowhere nears as boring). The characters almost leap off the screen as they are so believable. Then, with such an all-star cast (including Stiffler's mom. STIFFLER'S MOM)The DVD and Blu-Ray sales are going to be OFF THE CHARTS! I would suggest pre-ordering whatever deluxe steelbook 4k edition now as to not disappointment little Bobby or Suzie on Christmas morning. In the meantime, I would suggest multiple rewatches. Heck, find a homeless person and take them with you to see this film. It is so awesome and life-changing that when they are through witnessing this triumph of entertainment, the will no longer be a hobo.I really wish I had more stars to give.

Truly a masterpiece. Everyone did an outstanding job on this movie. The animation, the music, the story, the characters, everything. It's masterclass in every section. This is the best movie I have ever seen. The cinematography and screenplay were superb. the voice acting was incredible and I felt like I was on the phone throughout the whole film. There is no way this movie won't win Oscars for best picture, director, animated movie and all other categories.

I can say this is by far one of the funniest and most cringiest movies ever. Although it did surprise me on how well the animation is and the characters are fun and cute. I suggest you take the time to watch it and experience it yourself to see if a movie is good or not.

Definitely better then critics (who know diddly squat) rate. Thought it was funny, surprisingly endearing, and perfect for both kids and adult. It showed. There were hilarious moments, there were sad moments, there were romantic moments. I teared up at a certain part of the movie (don't wanna spoil it). I think my favorite person in the movie was Sir Patrick Stewart as the Poop Emoji. (I don't understand why he has a bow tie but I digress.) I feel like a better emoji could have been used instead of Meh but It still fit in alright. I DID NOT like that the Eggplant was part of the never used emojis because lets be honest (we all know how much it is used). All in all this was a quality movie.

This animated movie is SO UNDERRATED. Before it's release, I remember saying what everyone else did "Why are they making this movie?!" I was so quick to judge based on other animated films and "Hollywood's" reputation of unnecessary movies. Fast forward a couple years and I found this movie at my local library; figured I would give it watch with the family. We LOVED it! This movie was so well written. The animation was actually pretty good. T.J. Miller and James Corden were HILARIOUS together. So many good things occurred that I can't believe how poorly reviewed "Emoji Movie" was. If anyone rates this film lower than a 6/10 I think you may be biased by Pixar/Disney/DreamWorks expectations. The Emoji Movie was different but it was definitely good.

I could justify all the hate this movie gets if it's because Wreck It-Ralph and Inside Out did everything this movie did first. But me and my mom are in the 3% of people who still like this movie. If you kept an open mind for The Lego Movie, you'll probably keep an open mind for this movie as well. Did you know that the movie's slogan at the end of the credits is "Be Moved?" This movie succeeded at doing just that for me. Inside Out and Zootopia honestly never made me feel as many emotions as this movie did.This movie is way more overhated than Ghostbusters 2016, not that I found that movie to be abysmal either. I really liked having TJ Miller and Anna Faris and Patrick Stewart in this movie. The only people missing from the voice cast that this movie could have used were if Ashleigh Ball was a fierce fire emoji that sounded like Rainbow Dash and if Andrea Libman was a cheerful party hat that sounded like Pinkie Pie. Maybe they'll be in The Emoji Movie 2! I can't wait for that.Without spoiling any of the plot, I can say that this movie had 1 good message that might have been missing from Inside Out: People in real life don't want to act 1 way all the time, and that's the point of emojis in this film. Gene and Jailbreak are both emojis who want to accomplish the same goal of being an emoji with more than 1 expression, more than 1 character trait. That point was absent in Inside Out because it was just...Joy and Sadness want each other to see things from each other's perspective, but none of the emotion people on their own want to be a different emotion and they are the actual emotions of a person. Since The Emoji Movie takes place in a smart phone that is not connected to the human body and all of the emojis are their own person instead of another person's innate emotions, that gives the plot and characters a little more depth and flexibility to...not just act one way, which is what Dark Knight Court did with Bart and Mr. Burns. Plus, almost every face emoji is the same color, unlike with Inside Out.It's also got the concept of Wreck-It-Ralph of the main character not wanting to be one thing and traveling between different video games or apps. Ralph doesn't just want to be a villain and Gene doesn't just want to be Meh because he has tons of facial expressions, like many good actors do. Maybe that's what made this one of TJ Miller's more interesting roles.So if you still hate this movie, then that's fine, but don't have it come out of nowhere just for the sake of hating a movie based on Emojis. What if you actually like The Lego Movie in spite of it being based on Legos? Let's be real: Would you rather watch this glorious movie about Emojis learning to be well-rounded characters, or Stressed Eric, the torture porn series where the main character always fails, that in itself failed to make British humor work for American audiences?However, if there was anything I had to say in response to why the film is so hated, it's more hated for what it didn't do than what it did do. It really should have done more with Alex instead of having Gene, Hi-5 and Jailbreak going through games most of us already use that they easily could have gone around. I hope The Emoji Movie 2 doesn't insult us this much and has a more interesting plotline. If you had any faith in The Emoji Movie or believed that it could have worked, I would suggest sending a letter to Tony Leondis telling him how he can avoid these problems in case there is an Emoji Movie 2. There may not be a sequel, but it's good to give writing improvement tips anyway. How about making Gene and Hi-5 visit the emojis on Addie's phone?

This is currently my favourite movie of all time, never before have I been that excited to view a new movie. The entire 90 minutes was an exhilarating rush. I truly wish that it were longer, that I could prolong this poignant emotional experience. The character development is movingly evident by the end of the film, we watch these emoji characters grow as individuals and its a beautiful thing to experience. The Emoji Movie, while targeted at children provokes the responder to recognize an underlying darkness set within the film. Such is conveyed through the surrounding impending mortality that this film uses as its basis. It reminds us that we too face the threat of mortality and that in itself is a truly moving notion that strikes the viewer completely unawares and allows the film to boast a more mature foundation that only true artists could pull off via the challenging medium that is feature film. In conclusion, the Emoji Movie was an emotional experience that truly changed my outlook on the world through mature themes and altogether exceptional take on the world of film.

When this movie was announced, Emoji enthusiasts such as myself rejoiced. Finally, our most beloved property would be able to transcend its original, limiting medium. However, this excitement was overshadowed by creeping doubt. What if the poop emoji was not given a complete character arc? What if the culturally diverse sushi Emojis were whitewashed and misrepresented by white actors? And what if corporate executives censored the socially important two-men-holding-hands Emoji?All doubts were dismissed upon viewing this cinematic masterpiece. The creators' respect for the Emoji community was evident in every frame of this immaculate work of art. I laughed, I cried, I sat on the edge of my seat, I repeated steps 1-3 countless times, and, finally, I emerged from the cinema a changed man. The unmatched humor, emotionally complex tone, and beautiful animation of the Emoji Movie left me with only one, burning question: who did this?

Have you ever met someone and knew right away that they were the best thing that's ever happened to you? It feels strange because you've lived your entire life without even knowing they existed, but you wonder how you survived for this long without them in your life. I can honestly say that I've just felt true love for the first, and probably last, time in my life. For the longest time, you've listened to songs singing about love and romance, but you were never able to relate to them. All of the sudden, you are able to connect with nearly every single word you hear on an emotional level. You think about them literally all the time and can't imagine a future without them. It's funny how the tiniest chance encounter can have such profound effects. I feel really terrible and heartbroken now because I have to come to terms with the fact that my one true love may soon be gone for some time. The worst thing in the world is finding out that they don't share your feelings back. I know that this may seem like a lot of work just to express my feelings, but trust me, I would do so much more to show my love if I could. I am, of course, referring to The Emoji Movie!That is why it's about time I give my one true love, The Emoji Movie, the affection it deserves. Ever since I was introduced to The Emoji Movie on July 28, 2017, I became an entirely new person. I was just a kid hopelessly in love with something I knew would never return my feelings.I feel confident in saying that The Emoji Movie truly is the greatest film of all time. I don't think anything will ever make me believe otherwise (except for The Emoji Movie 2, of course). Not only is Gene, the multi-expressional Emoji, the greatest character ever put to film, he is also the most emotionally (dare I say, "emojinally?") complex and three-dimensional character I have ever seen. I praise Tony Leondis for effectively being able to make me care so much about a character that I would not normally give the time of day. The Emoji Movie has made me a better person because it taught me that there are always more layers to people. The Emoji Movie has the amazing message that it is OK to be yourself in an oppressive world that arbitrarily forces you to be one thing for your entire life. I have so much newfound respect for all Emojis now, especially the "Meh" (ðŸ˜’) Emoji. The plot of The Emoji Movie is too precious, unpredictable, creative, intelligent, entertaining, and enthralling to spoil for you here, but I will say it will have you on the edge of your seat for the entire 86 minutes no matter how many times you've already watched it. Every time I see it in theaters I buy a popcorn, but never even touch it because I am too focused on The Emoji Movie to notice anything going on outside of that screen. Films like The Emoji Movie are so special, they offer great educational value to children of all ages AND they offer a great, engaging, intense theater experience; something that sad excuse of a film, Dunkirk, couldn't offer. When I first walked out of my first Emoji Movie screening, I was shaking because I had just been on the greatest emotional roller coaster of my life. People may try and use Rotten Tomatoes, Metacritic, or IMDb as a credible source to justify why they think this masterpiece is bad. I am more than happy that The Emoji Movie is receiving rocky reviews from the start. Obviously it deserves 100% everywhere and from everyone, but some of the greatest films of the past were all miserably misunderstood at the time of their initial release. Like 2001: A Space Odyssey, many people who lack the brain capacity necessary to comprehend such important, life-changing messages presented in The Emoji Movie walked out of the theater. Citizen Kane, which is no longer considered the greatest film of all time since the release of The Emoji Movie July 28, 2017, was widely panned by audiences for being too progressive for its time. I will be waiting for the day when film schools all around the world show their students The Emoji Movie as an example of how to thematically, technically, and cinematically make a perfect film. Don't even get me started on the comedy aspect of it! The Emoji Movie is also the funniest movie ever! It has non-stop humor that makes me laugh every time I see it. Sometimes, I laugh so hard that I almost choke or pass out. Somehow, I was laughing for 106 minutes straight even though The Emoji Movie is only 86 minutes! Some of the jokes just stick with you long after the movie ends and you burst out laughing whenever you think of them. If you didn't notice, I tried to keep my Emoji usage here to a minimum. You may be wondering why I am doing this if I am such a big fan of The Emoji Movie. Well, that is because I learned from The Emoji Movie that not all Emojis were made to fit into only one emotion. I prefer to understand the Emoji's deeper feelings and emotions that may be contrary to the assumed emotion they are stereotyped to represent. I seriously pity anyone who uses Emojis when they haven't seen The Emoji Movie because they can't understand the deeper emotions the Emojis experience like us Emoji Movie fans can. Those people can only take the Emojis at face value.

This film is terribly underrated. I'd say it goes to par with art films such as The Genius of Synedoche. The movie has many layers and causes many emotions. The embarrassment Alex feels in the real world shows Gene's true inner torment. There's also an underlying theme of the DABDA scale, where Gene seems to be going through all 5 stages. It's hard to put everything into words, because this movie is so impressive for being for kids. He's clearly going through so much and i will continue to analyze this film further on later watches. I appreciate the time and effort put into creating this film, Sony has created a true masterpiece.

The Emoji Movie is a movie like no other. It stands alone in its appeal to people of all ages and in its presentation of comedy, romance, and creative story line. The Emoji Movie is a delightful comedy about an emoji and his quest to fit in. The movie has a brilliant story line, following the path of a confused emoji as he discovers friendship and love all in the face of hysterical comedy. The story line is layered for different levels of understanding; it is an enjoyable film for people of all ages. While there are subtle comedic lines amuse adults, it is the simple humor, such as the Poop emoji going to the toilet," that amuses children. The amazing cast of The Emoji Movie, including TJ Miller and Sir Patrick Stewart do a great job of living up to expectations. The Emoji Movie has something for everyone; it is a great animated tale that is wonderful for adults and children alike.

A masterpiece, great story and the jokes are stellar. Perfect execution, I love it! Definitely worth the penny and I would absolutely recommend this to all of my co-workers and movie enthusiast. Not only does it use emojis, which I am a big fan of, but it uses the poop one and I love the poop one, but it is voiced by Patrick Stewart, a movie legend. Hands down the best movie of the century so far.

The Emoji movie has to be the best film since Nativity 3. It showed how anything and everything can be loved. At some points I could feel the tears rolling down my cheeks. When I came out of the cinema I wish I could see it a billion more times, so that's what I did. Go see it with your family and friends. Best film.

I hate it when adults review children's films on IMDb and give it a bad rating cos hey it's a god damn children's movie for god sake and leave it for the children to review.my 7 year old loved it and would probably watch it again tomorrow if she could and i seen a few adult men in the cinema all alone and that is kind of creepy to be honest.

This was the best movie I have ever seen. The jokes are funny, especially the poop jokes, which is fun for the whole family.I forced my friends to watch this masterpiece, with low expectations, and oh how was I wrong! After the movie, I sent my friends to the gulag where they could work and watch the emoji movie for the rest of their pitiful lives! I rate this movie a ten for its unpredictable, funny, witty, modern humour. I can't recommend this movie enough, as I'm sitting at my desk cutting my wrists.And remember, horizontal for attention, vertical for results!

I have 2 sons--they're 6 years old and 3 years old. They both love emoji's. I took them to the movies to see this flick, and they both loved it. My younger son wants to see it again already. I'm their 42 year old father and liked it too. I thought it very cleverly showed how apps and emoji's and smart phones and the cloud all link together. I expected not to like it, but I ended up really enjoying it. I would recommend it for sure. Probably more appropriate for young kids though.

It was lit. The Emoji Movie was really great at communicating with teenagers. As teenagers, we feel as though this film really spoke to us on a emotional level. They spoke our language. It felt nice. We use emoji all the time, We like to use them while texting our friends and spinning our fidget spinners. At first, we watched the movie as a joke, but then, we realized that it was pretty good. This is because it is totally super a accurate to our everyday lives as high schools, my dudes.

I have heard SO MANY awful things about this movie, and if you knew me as a person, you would KNOW that that is EXACTLY what you need to do to get me to watch a movie/ read a book/ play a game etc. so when I saw that they'd put this on Netflix, I snatched the opportunity! And No, it's not powerful enough to bring you someone for chill...BUT all the reviews are WRONG! This is A GREAT little movie!!! It ALSO tells a GREAT lesson about being who you are, and standing up for what you think is right! Also that as parents, we need to support our children and ACTUALLY LISTEN to what they're telling us! Be who you're born to be! It was funny, fast paced, I love that unlike a LOT of movies, they never broke character, they ACTUALLY made everything accurate and the scenery reflecteda simulated phone! I was impressed with the level of thought that went into it! HIGHLY recommended!!!

The Emoji Movie changed my life. It is by far the best thing I've ever seen and I've seen porn.Great fun for the whole family, love the jokes, especially the poop ones. Very original. Will amaze you and your child.Go watch The Emoji Movie, you won't regret it.

Man I was wrong to think that this anime was not going to be that great but boy! Was I Wrong! The characters are original and well thought. The dramatic and epic story line keep the movie fast moving and exciting! This movie is almost as good as Shrek. Lets make a Shrek crossover happen people! Anyway, the animation is amazing and breathtaking and at one point made me want to buy some merchandise. The Character "Genie" Was amazing and and outstanding character. I think this movie just got the #1 spot on Another Top 10 Best Anime!

It was amazing. I Laughed harder watching this than any other animated film I have ever seen recently. Sausage party comes close. I can watch this with my nieces who are toddlers and we would all enjoy it. Most of the jokes are for a mature audience, I admit, but they were spot on. Kids might not appreciate poop punching a fan but they would love the colors and shapes and funny gimmicks. the parents who brought the kids to the theater would get big laughs. It doesn't matter how much critics pan this movie numbers speak for themselves: it opened in over 4000 theaters. They don't do that unless the movie has wide market appeal. If you didn't like it, It wasn't meant for you. Plain and simple

I am beginning to avoid relying on reviews when choosing to watch a film. It makes no sense as to why this film received such low reviews.It was well made with plenty of laughter for all of the family. Especially great for young children. I enjoyed the movie Wreck it Ralph. This is quite similar to that so I enjoyed the whole structure of the movie. The idea of meh emoji trying to find himself and express himself truly is a great message to kids. It's full of laughs and is definitely worth watching. I am only giving this a 10 to help balance out the bad reviews.

I have no idea who these people are that are giving bad reviews, but I'm assuming individuals that have a purpose rather than ones that have seen this movie? It was absolutely adorable!I went with my 5 year old grandson and my daughter. All three of us loved the movie! Taking the enthusiastic applause from both young and old at the end of the movie, I'm assuming the same holds true for at least most of the rest of the audience. The few reviews I read seemed to want to find some deep meaning in this cute little cartoon. If they just watched the movie for the fun hourish it is, rather than getting into their own minds, the reviewers might have had a fun time. Don't go expecting anything other than a cartoon fun time as that is what it is. As that was what we were looking for, we had a perfect evening at the movies with this movie!!!

What do you do if your mom gives you 10$? Anybody? You go get a 20 pack of Krispy Kreams! But honestly, this film turns movies like Avatar and Creed upside down. This film shall sweep the Oscars, and I can't wait for a sequel! This film made me cry tears of happiness P.S I do not actually think this was amazing, viewing it made me wish EVERY SINGLE phone on the planet was destroyed. It was a poor excuse for a movie. It really ticks me that someone in there RIGHT MIND would cancel Popeye for this shite. Oh, and when I said in my "Work of art" paragraph, this film made me cry tears of happiness, I meant DEPRESSION! CRIPPLING DEPRESSION!

Sure the movie sometimes mimics Wreck it Ralph and Inside Out, but this movie I loved! Ignore the 3.3/10 star rate and just check it out. If you don't like it, don't watch. But I'm just saying this movie deserves more love in my opinion. If it's that underrated then would you rather watch Shrek 3 or Home Alone 4?
UNBELIEVABLY GOOD MOVIE. YOU SHOULD WATCH IT AT ALL COST!!

With 3 little ones at home we watch a lot of kids movies. Emoji was a lot like Wreck it Ralph in its practicality and humor. It had kids humor as well as adult humor. It had a good story line as well, a little bit of action, love and irony. This was an all around entertaining kids movie.

This movie is defiantly underrated on IMDb, 2.5/10 under 24,200 votes? Even Angry Birds Movie comes with 6.3/10 under 59,820 users votes up to now, Oct 19, 2017. Also, the reviews on IMDb are pretty polarized. Negative 1 stars filled with first page, then 10 stars came up next. Interested to know how their standard is.At least I found Emoji movie was funnier to watch compared to Angry Birds. Emoji's world setting is more creative compare to angry birds. Its storyline is clear and compete, although the story is quit simple, but I still enjoyed the movie. To have another example to compare, I would say this emoji movie is better than Smurfs 3 as well, rating 2.3/10 on IMDb is defiantly underrated and unreliable. Speak fairly, I would rate it above 7, but not highly up to 8. Yet the movie was terriblely underrated below 3, so I would personally rated it in 8.

I essentially created an IMDb account to write a review for this movie as the current 2.1/10 really isn't justified. I went to see this with my 4.5 year old girl after explaining about emoji's and showing her the various emoji's on my phone (which she had great fun sending to her gran etc over whatsapp). She enjoyed the movie very much and for someone who is normally a little frightened in movies, there were the 'bot' characters but the movie wasn't dark and she wasn't afraid. She was overjoyed to see all the apps like youtube, facebook, just dance etc that she recognized. As an adult there was some subtle IT humor with internet trolls (who ironically get trolled!) and cute moments.Sure its not an amazing movie, but its cute and your kids will enjoy it - especially as its today relevant.

I'm not sure of WHY there are very low ratings. It's a good and funny kid's movie! There was a plot and I thought the movie flowed very well. I truly enjoyed laughing at the characters on screen. PLEASE take young kids. They WILL enjoy themselves. Tweens and older kids may not enjoy it, as much.

Hey, just watched this movie with family, and it was great! Not a history breaker, but a great, lightweight movie to have fun, minimal violence (fits everyone over 6), many references to this crazy mobile-app World we are living in.I liked the characters, most loved Jailbreaker, and poop. I also liked the world Emojis are living in. The story has some lightweight teaching, too.

I thought it was a nice movie and really enjoyed it. Glad I did not pay attention to negative reviews. I frankly don't get what everyone is complaining about, it's a children's movie! Furthermore the story is very innovative and creative. It is not claiming to be James bond, Startrek or something it is not! It's a movie where character are Emojies.Those who did not like this film have lost touch with their inner child. Very sad...
